SuperTank.name: Cullen Predator Mk. III
SuperTank.description: This gargantuan beast is the brainchild of Gray Cullen. Once thought impossible, the Predator was Cullen's idea of how a great ship might operate on land. It boasts two sets of quad-barrelled grenade launches and a heavy-duty 94.5mm forward facing cannon. While limitations of ground-based travel posed certain restrictions on the scope of the project, Cullen wasn't deterred and made necessary adjustments to meet his vision of the ideal land ship.
SuperTank.ammoUsed: 94.5mm, Tremola Grenade GPb-1, PT-815 Smoke Grenade, Green Ash Grenade, A3 Harpa Fragmentation Grenade

Gunner (Front): Equipped with a high velocity barrel that deals 25% extra damage per shot
High chance to penetrate armoured vehicles
Higher base chance to disable vehicle subsystems

BattleTank.name: Flood Mk. I
BattleTank.description: A heavy-duty Battle Tank with thick armour plating and destructive firepower. The Flood is fitted with a 75mm turret and a front-facing 12.7mm anti-infantry machine gun. The heavy armour limits top speed, but in exchange it can take a lot of punishment.

general: Can be carried by vehicles that support up to large sized shippables
Turret (Center): High chance to penetrate armoured vehicles
Turret (Front): Equipped with a low velocity barrel that deals 36% less damage per shot

BattleTankFlame.name: Flood Juggernaut Mk. VII
BattleTankFlame.description: The Juggernaut is a heavily armoured Flood variant fitted with a heavy flamethrower turret that fires an advanced adhesive propellant. Its shovel-like treads may hinder top speeds, but this beast is quite capable in extreme weather conditions.

general: Can be carried by vehicles that support up to large sized shippables
Turret (Center): High chance to penetrate armoured vehicles

BattleTankSPG.name: Flood Mk. IX Stain
BattleTankSPG.description: Built on an inverted Flood chassis, the Mk. IX Stain is a fully-featured mobile artillery platform. Once deployed, a 150mm cannon over long-distances to pummel enemy positions with indirect fire.

general: Can be carried by vehicles that support up to large sized shippables
Cannoneer: Can ruin structures that have been severly damaged by artillery
